name: Daniel PORCELLINI, Petitioner, v. INTERNATIONAL MANAGEMENT CONSULTANTS, INC. and Granite Run Mall and Equitable Life Assurance Society, Ind. and t/a Granite Run Mall and Granite Run Mall, Inc. and Roman Mosaic & Tile Company, U.S. Dismantlement & R.C. Company, Respondents
name_abbreviation: Porcellini v. International Management Consultants, Inc.

parties: Daniel PORCELLINI, Petitioner, v. INTERNATIONAL MANAGEMENT CONSULTANTS, INC. and Granite Run Mall and Equitable Life Assurance Society, Ind. and t/a Granite Run Mall and Granite Run Mall, Inc. and Roman Mosaic & Tile Company, U.S. Dismantlement & R.C. Company, Respondents.

opinions.text:
ORDER
PER CURIAM:
AND NOW this 29th day of October, 1997, the Petition for Allowance of Appeal is GRANTED. This matter is REMANDED to the trial court for further proceedings in accordance with this Court’s recent decision in Cheeseman v. Lethal Exterminator, Inc., 549 Pa. 200, 701 A.2d 156 (1997).
opinions.author: PER CURIAM:

casebody.head_matter:
702 A.2d 357
Daniel PORCELLINI, Petitioner, v. INTERNATIONAL MANAGEMENT CONSULTANTS, INC. and Granite Run Mall and Equitable Life Assurance Society, Ind. and t/a Granite Run Mall and Granite Run Mall, Inc. and Roman Mosaic & Tile Company, U.S. Dismantlement & R.C. Company, Respondents.
Supreme Court of Pennsylvania.
Oct. 29, 1997.
Richard Glassman, Philadelphia, for petitioner.
